intro: Oenothera sinuata var. bicolor, commonly known as the pink and white evening primrose, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It is characterized by its striking bi-colored flowers, which typically feature pink petals with white centers. The plant is herbaceous, with slender, branching stems and lance-shaped leaves that are often hairy. It produces showy, tubular flowers that open in the evening, attracting nocturnal pollinators such as moths. This species is adapted to arid environments and thrives in well-drained soils.
